events.title: Christopher Columbus lands in Jamaica
events.description: During his second voyage to the New World, Christopher Columbus and his crew arrived at the island of Jamaica, which became a Spanish colony.
events.significance: This event marked further Spanish exploration and expansion into the Caribbean, influencing subsequent colonization efforts.

events.title: Polish Constitution of May 3rd adopted
events.description: The Polishâ€“Lithuanian Commonwealth adopted the Constitution of May 3, 1791, Europe's first and the world's second modern codified constitution.
events.significance: It was a pioneering legal document aimed at reforming and strengthening the Commonwealth, influencing democratic movements in Europe.

events.title: German airship Hindenburg disaster
events.description: The LZ 129 Hindenburg, a German passenger airship, caught fire and was destroyed during its attempt to dock at the Lakehurst Naval Air Station in New Jersey, USA.
events.significance: The disaster marked the end of the airship era and was a significant event in aviation history due to the loss of life and media coverage.

events.title: House Un-American Activities Committee begins investigation of Hollywood
events.description: The HUAC began investigating alleged communist influence in the film industry, leading to blacklisting and censorship in Hollywood.
events.significance: This was a key moment in the Red Scare and Cold War-era politics shaping American culture and politics.

events.title: Margaret Thatcher becomes UK Prime Minister
events.description: Margaret Thatcher was sworn in as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, becoming the first woman to hold the position.
events.significance: Her leadership marked a significant political shift in the UK with the introduction of conservative economic and social policies.
